title: Version 1.2.6 error with Java runtime
body:
Hello,

there is an issues while compiling the newest 1.2.6 version in Android SKD.

> Task :capgo-capacitor-social-login:compileDebugJavaWithJavac FAILED
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: error: invalid source release: 21

The package wants to use Java 21, while the latest supported runtime is 17.
author: Tomjech16

comments.body: use "@capacitor/core": "6.2.0",
is there support for "@capacitor/core": "^7.0.0", ?
1.2.6 is for capacitor 7, i will upgrade the number to follow the name of our others plugins

comments.body:
We cannot individually reject one that why do reject all, but i think you can init multiple time and split each of them.
Thanks for the feedback

title: Use official capacitor versioning
body:
I'd recommend to follow capacitor official convention for plugin version. It'd be great to bump this plugin to v7 as it's now using capacitor 7.

I can open a PR if you agree with that :)
author: MaximeSIMET

comments.body: Agree just done it :)

title: Login fails if profile doesn't have last name present for google login
body:
- Use version `0.0.68-alpha.7` 
- Create google profile without last name

Try calling in login method. Exception is thrown `Invalid or missing "family_name" property.` 

Expectation:

Please do not kill login process.
author: ashishc

comments.body: What platform? Also, please use the latest version of the plugin. Please migrate AWAY from the alpha version
I am closing this issue. The alpha version is no longer supported, and no bugs will be resolved relating to it. Please migrate to the main version and if the issue persists, open a new issue.

title: Facebook web not working when user is not already logged in
body:
Facebook provider is throwing an error on web when user is not already logged in. It does work fine when the user was already logged in. The same happens on iOS when there is no native Facebook app installed and it fallbacks to web login.

The error is `Error: Facebook login failed`
author: co-dax

comments.body: do it's linked to your issue with webview relead?

Yes that was the issue.
Thanks!

title: Facebook refresh is not implemented
body:
Hi,

I need to be able to refresh token for Facebook because of iOS returns valid token only for 1 hour. But when I want to use refresh method, plugin tells me that it is not implemented. 

How to refresh tokens then?

Thanks
author: cihakmar

comments.body: CC: @riderx

@WcaleNieWolny thanks for your implementation but refresh method returns only `accessToken`:  `{"idToken":null,"expiresIn":null,"refreshToken":null,"accessToken":"did6ZIb2Qeg...."}`. Is it possible to edit refresh method to return all values?

Thanks
I am not sure that idToken or refreshToken are available. As for `expiresIn`, I tried to implement it, but it returned some nonsensical data (it said that the token expires in the year 4005).
Can you please try to implement `idToken `. I do not know why, but on iOS I need to use this token instead of accessToken. also in first login I am using this token...
It would be nice to give us more info on why you need it, as facebook work for others users :)
@riderx When I use Facebook login on iOS it`s response includes idToken and access token. But when I try to decode accessToken it is not valid jet, but idToken is...
That is the intended behavior. Could you tell me why do you believe that this is a bug?

Also, perhaps you should use limited login?

From what I observed, when limited login is turned off, Facebook provider will return access token (which will not be a valid JWT). When using limited login, it will return idToken (valid JWT)
@WcaleNieWolny I used limitedLogin, but response of refresh is still without idToken...

title: The scope of Sign in with Apple in the Readme is incorrect (invalid_request - Invalid client scope)
author: badung7576x

comments.body: @riderx ping :)

title: Fix of facebook profile fetching on Android API 30+
body:
The plugin will not return accessToken but not the profile data on Android API 30+.

It will crash on "android.os.NetworkOnMainThreadException". 

I fixed the code to explicitly run the request on a background thread.
author: kasik96

comments.body: thanks a lot

title: Sign in with Apple - Private Relay Email
body:
Hi there,

Thanks for the work on this plugin. 

I was implementing Apple Id into my capacitor app and passing "email" and "profile" scopes.

If I choose to share my email then "email" comes through. 

However if I pick the hide my email it shows a private relay email address - e.g. ****@privaterelay.appleid.com but then the "email" field is empty.

I'm not sure this is the expected behaviour or an issue?
author: DrBeza

comments.body:
The email value is never empty when using `@capacitor-community/apple-sign-in` package.
It's either real email or `xxxxxxxxxx@privaterelay.appleid.com`

This appears to be working as stated on a real phone. 

I am guessing using the simulator was the problem here.

title: fix(apple): added missing nonce config
body: Even though the plugin lets you configure nonce for the Apple provider, the plugin simply ignores this when making the native requests. I added the appropriate code to fix this for login requests.
author: mattk-mke

comments.body: thanks for this

title: Effect of `npm run prettier`
body:
Or `npm run prettier -- --write` to be precise

I think it's quite important as I usually run prettier on new pull requests and without this on main branch diffs would also show formatting changes,
author: piotr-cz

comments.body: the correct command to run is `npm run fmt` thanks for running this one
yes, but `npm run fmt` fails on eslint now
Do not merge it just yet, offline access is a WiP
We need to support same min version as capacitor
Closing in favor of #56

title: AuthenticationToken not returned in FB Limited Login
body:
Description: In the SocialLoginPlugin.swift file, the authenticationToken is not returned when performing a Facebook Limited Login. Although the token is successfully retrieved in the FacebookLoginResponse, only the accessToken and profile fields are included in the response, which prevents the front-end from accessing the authenticationToken required for further authentication steps.

This issue specifically affects scenarios where Facebook Limited Login is used.

Steps to reproduce:

Initiate a Facebook Limited Login using the SocialLoginPlugin with the limited login option set in the payload.
Observe the response object returned to the front-end.
Notice that authenticationToken is missing, while accessToken and profile are present.
Expected Behavior: The response object should include the authenticationToken field, along with the accessToken and profile, especially when using Facebook Limited Login.

Current Behavior: The authenticationToken is not returned in the login result for Facebook when using Limited Login. The relevant code section omits this field.

Affected Code: In the file SocialLoginPlugin.swift, the method handleLoginResult currently returns the following for Facebook:


```
else if let facebookResponse = response as? FacebookLoginResponse {
    call.resolve([
        "provider": "facebook",
        "result": [
            "accessToken": facebookResponse.accessToken,
            "profile": facebookResponse.profile
        ]
    ])
}
```
Proposed Fix: Modify the handleLoginResult method to include the authenticationToken in the response for Facebook Limited Login:


```
else if let facebookResponse = response as? FacebookLoginResponse {
    call.resolve([
        "provider": "facebook",
        "result": [
            "accessToken": facebookResponse.accessToken,
            "profile": facebookResponse.profile,
            "authenticationToken": facebookResponse.authenticationToken ?? ""
        ]
    ])
}
```

 The authenticationToken is a critical part of Facebook Limited Login and is required for verifying the login state. Please ensure the authenticationToken is properly returned to the front-end, allowing full access to the necessary authentication details when using Facebook Limited Login.
author: Linknpay

comments.body: Thanks for the report, it should be good now !
i realize the return value didn't follow the definition it's now fixed
